title.bibl: Saloniki-Greek Press, May 10, 1924. Grand Theatrical Presentation

notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

body.p: P. 6 - The Pan Dramatic Company will present the play "The Adopted Daughter and the Bandit Chief Krikelas" at the Blackstone Theater on Sunday, May 18, at 8:30 P. M. The cast has been trained by Mr. Paul Telegan, dramatic instructor, and Miss Manou and Mrs. Katanogia have the leading parts. It is an idyllic drama in three scenes by Ieannes Botsares. Tickets are on sale at the Blackstone Theater,at the Atlantis Bookstore, and at Mouzakiotes Brothers' store.
